_header: If that thou list for to intend / Of this book to hear legend
Title(s): Þe Prologue of þe kalundare of þis litell booke (Shirley)
_description: ‘Þe Prologue of þe kalundare of þis litell booke’: John Shirley’s metrical index to his volume of poems — 104 lines in couplets

BLAdd16165.First Lines:
If þat you list for to entendeOf þis booke to here
                    legende…
BLAdd16165.Last Lines:
…And euery womman of hir louePrey I to god þat
                    sitteþe aboue
BLAdd16165.Note:
Follows on from 1403 without a
                    break. Explicit followed by four lines of Latin ending prologus per Shirley (f.
                        3v).
BLAdd16165.Attributed Title:
þe prologe of þe Kalundere of þis litell booke (f.
                    2)
BLAdd16165.Editions:
Gaertner,  Otto. 
             John Shirley.
         Halle: E. Karrus, 1904: 63.
Brusendorff,  Aage. 
             The Chaucer Tradition.
         Copenhagen, 1925; repr. Oxford: Clarendon, 1967: 453.
Hammond,  Eleanor Prescott. 
             English Verse between Chaucer and Surrey.
         Durham, NC: Duke UP, 1927: 194-6.
